oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Work camps; Men; Queues; Tableware
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Men of Civilian Conservation Corps Company 1466 standing in a chow line with plates in their hands.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back At Tennessee Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Company 1466 was formed at Ft. Oglethorpe, Georgia, on May 22, 1933. It helped with soil conservation projects. It was also assigned the care and development of Bledsoe Forest.
